io::PropertyParser Class Reference
[Input/output library]

#include <PropertyParser.h>

Inheritance diagram for io::PropertyParser:

[legend]
List of all members.

Detailed Description

Parses key=value style property pairs from character string.

Pairs are separated by newline. Keys are parsed to lower-case to provide case-insensitive comparison. Trailing and preceding whitespace of values is ignored. Comments can be embedded with line starting with '--'.

For any complex configuration files Lua scripts should be used, but this class is suitable for conditions where for example heap memory allocations need to be avoided.

bool io::PropertyParser::get (  const char *  key,
lang::Array< char > &  x
)  const
 

Parses key=x user property and returns x as 0-terminated character string.

Parameters:
key Name of the property to find.
x [out] Receives parsed property string.
Returns:
false if property not found, true otherwise.
Exceptions:
IOException 

bool io::PropertyParser::getBoolean (  const char *  key  )  const
 

Parses key=x user property and returns x as boolean.

Following values are interpreted as 'false':

  • false
  • disabled
  • 0
Following values are interpreted as 'true':
  • true
  • enabled
  • 1
Parameters:
key Name of the property to find.
Returns:
Boolean value.
Exceptions:
IOException 

const char* io::PropertyParser::getString (  const char *  key  )  const
 

Parses key=x user property and returns x as 0-terminated string.

String is valid until next call to PropertyParser.

Parameters:
key Name of the property to find.
Returns:
0-terminated key value.
Exceptions:
IOException

Returns:
